name: Soy-Marinated Pork Sandwiches
author: Cooking44
ingredients: 12 ounces pork tenderloin, trimmed and thinly sliced
¼ cup diagonally sliced green onions
directions: Whisk soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, sambal oelek, sesame oil, and ginger together in a large bowl
Add pork; toss well to coat
Let stand at room temperature, about 15 minutes
Whisk rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon oil, and white sugar together in a bowl
Add carrot strips, green onions, and cilantro; toss to coat
Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Place buns on a baking sheet, cut sides up
Heat remaining 1 teaspoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add pork; cook, turning occasionally, until no longer pink in the center, 3 to 5 minutes
Broil buns in the preheated oven until lightly toasted, 1 to 2 minutes
Top bottom halves of buns evenly with pork and carrot mixture
Cover with top halves of buns
